metadata.title: CVE-2015-1244 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The URLRequest::GetHSTSRedirect function in url_request/url_request.cc inGoogle Chrome before 42.0.2311.90 does not replace the ws scheme with thewss scheme whenever an HSTS Policy is active, which makes it easier forremote attackers to obtain sensitive information by sniffing the networkfor WebSocket traffic.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1244` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-browser-l10n - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-chromedriver - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.6.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.6.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.6.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.6.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.6.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.6.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.6.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
